2o The important condition of this pheno 
menon is before all this a concentrating of for[m?]
and nutritive sap by means of many indi 
viduals.
3o This nutritive sap is the single material 
is the beginning and is the principle power 
of all progressiv complications of the ani 
mal’s life.
The concentration can become not only by 
the colonial physiological narrow bounded 
organisms but by free living social orga 
nisms. Many molluscs, Crustaceans and 
principally Insects present to us a gre[at]
many examples of it. 
As such in the group of the Molluscs 
Lamellibranchiata we find the constantly 
sitting Ostreida, between which exist or
ganisms most compound of all the group;
- organisms with well develloped eyes. In
Crustacea we can indicate the group of
Cyrrhipedia to which belong higher deve 
loped and the larger organisms of the lo
west forms of the whole classes. In In[secta?]
we find so often the exampls of social 
life in almost all tribes and famili[es]
and principally between the Hymenopt[era]
where this life is builed on the physio 
logical division of labour. This division 
we must also consider as a progre[sive?]
step in the development.
